results.title: Coromby - every Monday night
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the 6 works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region.
The Coromby Brass Band is a group of farmers who come together every Monday night to practice in a draughty hall beside the wheat silos on a back road outside the small town of Murtoa. Formed in 1891, the band is the oldest continuously active brass band in Australia. Many members have been involved for decades - in some cases, their fathers and grandfathers played in the band before them. In this film, members of the band talk about what keeps them turning up at the hall “every Monday night”.

results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Daniel von Sturmer
results.brief_description: Continuing from his ‘Truth Effect’ series, and the tradition of George Méliès, Daniel von Sturmer creates a miniature environment in which an everyday object behaves in unexpected ways.

results.title: Fountain
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Shaun Gladwell
results.brief_description: Featuring renowned breakdancer Morganics pulling his moves in a water fountain, Shaun Gladwell’s street-wise video ‘painting’ plays with performance, gravity and time to unsettle expectations of urban space.

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - DAMP (Full potato jacket)
results.brief_description: The scene is familiar. A scene you know well. A buffet setting of multinational brands adorns a beautifully set table. Products which for years you have been told you want; you need. The camera pans the table. You recognise everything. So what happens when the desirable turns undesirable? Melbourne art collective DAMP wage war on themselves in a gluttonous, misappropriation of food. A food fight of excessive proportions aims to subvert the subliminal desire global advertising has imposed, via mass media, on mainstream Australia.

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Katrina Sawyer (Decent, generous, tolerant, open minded [white] people)
results.brief_description: A half-hour program that references the global success of the soap-opera Neighbours. Consisting of three nine-minute segments by an emerging documentarian, an emerging fiction moving image maker and a visual artist, Neighbours (the remix) will playfully subvert and imaginatively redraw the landscape of Australia suburbia. As part of Neighbours (the remix) there will be interspersed ad-breaks (30 second duration each) by five leading, established Australian art practitioners.

results.title: Godspeed Verticals
results.brief_description: A dual screen digital video installation, “Godspeed Verticals” explores BMX bicycle riding and skateboarding and its relations to and functions within the urban environment through the large scale projection of two sequences of actions skewed at 90 degree angles. Recorded in a deliberately anonymous and generic underground carpark and walkway and presented in slow motion, these sequences subtly reference visual cultural practices and spectatorship in an art historical context while engaged in a meditative study of contemporary activities of urban expression. In the first sequence, the camera follows a single BMX bicycle rider as they manoeuvre towards the darkened exit/entrance of a vast walkway, the bike and rider alike appearing to be pulled up and beyond the frame through the skewed presentation of the image. A loose translation of Caspar David Friedrich’s ‘Wanderer above the Sea of Fog’ (1818), the image stages the sublime position of the lone character in Friedrich’s painting in its representation of the BMX bicycle rider’s spatial orientation in and interaction with the contemporary urban landscape. Sequence two presents an aerial view of skateboarders falling into a tiled wall, some alone and others grouped together, with subtle reflections in composition on the geometry of Abstract art and the distant framing of imagery and figures in Western religious artworks. A layered soundscape of the sounds derived from the focal environment accompanies the projections to produce a low volume ambience for the on screen movements.

results.title: Body code
results.brief_description: computer generated animation accurately portraying activity within the body at cellular level. Produced in conjunction with medical researchers.
results.description: computer generated animation accurately portraying activity within the body at cellular level. Produced in conjunction with medical researchers.

results.title: Stencil art
results.brief_description: This DV Public Imaging work explores the graphic street art of stencil painting. This predominantly political form of street communication and resistance has risen in visibility in recent years. Using the streets of Melbourne as the visual basis for this work, the viewer will be afforded the vision of the different visual and textual styles, edited into a work that is, at times, abstract and, at others, forcefully potent in its political delivery.
